definition: Faraday (name)/Michael Faraday (1791-1867), British experimental physicist prominent in the development of electricity
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just

sentences.english: Fiber magnetic field sensor may be achieved by using Faraday magneto optic effect.
sentences.chinese: 利用法拉第磁光效應可以設計光纖磁場傳感器。

sentences.english: On carrying our his experiment, Faraday discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 在進行實驗時，法拉第發現了電磁感應現象。
分析了法拉第後期做的實驗。

sentences.english: The discovery was foreseen more than 150 years ago by Michael Faraday, the father of electricity.
sentences.chinese: 電學之父法拉第早到150年前就預見了這個發現。

sentences.english: Faraday was the scientist who discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 法拉第是發現電磁感應的科學家。

sentences.english: Farady angle formulas of crystalline phase and noncrystalline phase interfaces are derived.
sentences.chinese: 導出晶相與非晶相界面法拉第角計算公式。
法拉第做了銀的電解實驗。

sentences.english: And building a conventional Faraday cage round a naval vessel would be horribly expensive.
sentences.chinese: 而且，爲一艘軍艦造一個常規的法拉第籠會非常昂貴。

sentences.english: After listening to Davy, he asked the great man for a job.
sentences.chinese: 聽課之餘，法拉第請求偉人給他一份工作。

sentences.english: Faraday used no mathematics at all to prove his rule.
sentences.chinese: 法拉第完全沒有用數學方法來證明他的定律。
